<JD_START>
Job Title: MAINTENANCE MECHANIC IV

Location: Wilsonville, OR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Manufacturing, Production, Supply Chain

Description:
At TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world. 

Job Overview

TE Connectivity's Maintenance Teams perform repairs and preventive maintenance to ensure longer lifespan of machines and facilities. Every team member is responsible for maintaining housekeeping and organization of the work area as well as following TE Connectivity's EH&S policies and procedures.

Responsibilities

 Provide maintenance support to production focused on maximizing the quality of equipment performance and it's availability for use by manufacturing. Install, start up, and shut down equipment by company safety procedures for machine activation and shutdown and in line with OSHA requirements. Investigate and repair production machinery as required. Assist Maintenance Operations in the control and maintenance of the spare parts inventory. Requires researching, ordering, and maintaining records of parts and supplies. Perform work from directions in the form of verbal instruction, blueprints, or sketches with no supervision and create all required documentation. Review and make recommendations for Preventative Maintenance of machinery. Lead and perform emergency repair efforts for all equipment in use. On-time completion of assigned preventive maintenance inspections. On-time completion of assigned projects. Provide feedback and input for project planning. Must be able to work well with all levels of personnel whether individually or in a team environment and be able to interface and communicate with line operators in order to assist with repairs. Professional, upbeat, energetic, takes initiative, dependable, takes pride in work, and possesses the ability to manage time effectively.

This is a Monday to Friday 8 am to 5 pm position.

What Your Background Should Look Like

 Ability to visualize parts of machinery to be maintained or repaired. Ability to read/interpret electrical, and pneumatic diagrams. Ability to interpret blueprints, sketches, models, or other visual aids. Ability to get along with others and work in a team environment. Ability to act independently with minimal supervision. Ability to be innovative and creative, and adapt to change. Maintain a cheerful, positive, can-do attitude, being responsive and approachable. Knowledge of and experience with the use of measuring tools, hand and power tools Knowledge of and experience with MS Excel and MS Word Knowledge of and experience with machining is preferred Knowledge of and experience with CAD/Solidwork is preferred. Bending, stooping, and /or remaining in a standing position for extended periods Manual dexterity to manipulate objects to precise positions. Applies knowledge, skills, judgment, and initiative to complete a wide range of difficult tasks. Requires a High School Diploma/GED and 4 years of related experience or local equivalent. AA Degree in a related discipline or local equivalent and 7 years of related experience is preferred.

Competencies

Values: Integrity, Accountability, Inclusion, Innovation, Teamwork

About Te Connectivity

TE Connectivity is a global industrial technology leader creating a safer, sustainable, productive, and connected future. Our broad range of connectivity and sensor solutions enable the distribution of power, signal and data to advance next-generation transportation, renewable energy, automated factories, data centers, medical technology and more. With more than 85,000 employees, including 8,000 engineers, working alongside customers in approximately 140 countries. TE ensures that EVERY CONNECTION COUNTS. Learn more at

Compensation

 Competitive base salary commensurate with experience: $60,720 – $91,080 (subject to change dependent on physical location) Posted salary ranges are made in good faith. TE Connectivity reserves the right to adjust ranges depending on the experience/qualification of the selected candidate as well as internal and external equity. Total Compensation = Base Salary + Incentive(s) + Benefits

Benefits

 A comprehensive benefits package including health insurance, 401(k), disability, life insurance, employee stock purchase plan, paid time off and voluntary benefits.

EOE, Including Disability/Vets

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
